description: The island headquarters of the Marines, where the execution of Portgas D. Ace takes place. A crescent moon-shaped island composed of bricks and steel with the Oris Plaza at its center.

keyEvents.title: Luffy vs. Garp Confrontation
keyEvents.description: The emotional confrontation between Luffy and Garp takes place at Marineford as Luffy fights to reach the execution platform.
keyEvents.significance: One of the most emotionally charged battles in the war, representing the clash between family bonds and duty.

keyEvents.title: Ace Regains Fire Powers
keyEvents.description: After being freed from Sea Stone handcuffs, Ace uses his fire powers at Marineford to save everyone from falling.
keyEvents.significance: Marks Ace's return to active combat and the seeming success of the rescue mission.

statusHistory.reason: Site of the Summit War and Ace's execution attempt

description: The scaffold structure at the center of Marineford's Oris Plaza where Portgas D. Ace is scheduled for public execution. The platform stands as the focal point of the Summit War.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Reaches the Platform
keyEvents.description: After defeating Garp, Luffy successfully reaches the execution scaffold where Ace is held.
keyEvents.significance: The culmination of Luffy's desperate journey through Marineford to reach his brother.

keyEvents.title: Sengoku Destroys the Scaffold
keyEvents.description: Sengoku's Buddha shockwave attack destroys the execution platform, causing everyone to fall.
keyEvents.significance: The destruction of the scaffold symbolizes the shattering of Marine authority and control over the execution.

keyEvents.title: Ace Freed on Falling Platform
keyEvents.description: As the platform collapses and everyone falls, Luffy uses Mr. 3's wax key to unlock Ace's handcuffs.
keyEvents.significance: The climactic moment where Ace is finally freed, achieving the goal of the rescue mission.

statusHistory.reason: Destroyed by Sengoku's Buddha shockwave attack
